intro: Tacsonia mixta, commonly known as the mixed tacsonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in early summer. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Tacsonia mixta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
